UCjVu8ba.question: In a typical air conditioning system of modern large transport aeroplanes the reduction of air temperature and pressure is achieved by

options.text: an expansion turbine.
a compressor.
an evaporator.
a condenser.

CTf22vlL.question: The operation of manual pressurisation control is:

options.text: achieved by a second circuit operating the outflow valve.
achieved by a second circuit operating the pressure relief valves.
achieved by fully opening or fully closing the outflow valve.
only operated on the ground.

M9hHtOp4.question: In a typical "bootstrap" cooling system the supply air is:

options.text: compressed, passed through a secondary heat exchanger, and then across an expansion turbine.
passed across an expansion turbine, then through a secondary heat exchanger and then across a compressor.
passed across an expansion turbine, then compressed and passed through a heat exchanger.
passed across an expansion turbine, then directly to the heat exchanger.

GLJrhshV.question: Assuming cabin differential pressure has reached the required value in normal flight conditions, if flight altitude and air conditioning system setting are maintained

options.text: the mass air flow through the cabin is constant.
the pressurization system ceases to function until leakage reduces the pressure.
the outflow valves will move to the fully open position.
the outflow valves will move to the fully closed position.

vlol3NPP.question: The manual mode of pressurization in a jet airplane:

options.text: Uses a separate circuit to modulate the opening of the outflow valve.
Acts only on the pressure relief valves.
Only allows to fully open or close the outflow valve.
Cannot be used in flight.

xv9nsh2q.question: In a large transport aeroplane the main temperature reduction of the conditioned air is achieved in:

options.text: the heat exchangers.
the condenser.
the expansion turbine.
the evaporator.
delivering a substantially constant flow of air into the cabin and controlling the outflow.
the cabin air re-circulation system.
the cabin air mass flow control inlet valve(s).
controlling the flow of air into the cabin with constant outflow.

6TA4fxwO.question: In a bootstrap cooling system, the bleed air is compressed to

options.text: ensure an adequate temperature drop in the secondary heat exchanger.
ensure an adequate air flow across the secondary heat exchanger.
increase the cabin air supply pressure when the inlet pressure is too low.
maintain a constant cabin mass air flow.

ZJR9g7mT.question: Which of the following is a typical source of air for the pneumatic system of a piston engine aircraft?

options.text: Supercharger air
Cylinder bleed air
Intake manifold air
Ram air

JYafEIzF.question: On a typical gas-turbine engine aircraft, the pneumatic air bleed system uses air supplied from the engine...

options.text: compressor.
turbine.
exhaust.
inlet.

aOTZMYkL.question: What is the advantage of an electrical air pressurization system over a bleed air system?

options.text: Reduced take-off distance due to more thrust available.
It is less fuel efficient.
It is cheaper.

vHJMupRC.question: In flight, the cabin air for large jet transport aeroplanes is usually supplied by ..

options.text: engine compressors.
ram air intakes.
single radial compressors.
piston compressors.

81cVBHqz.question: In the pneumatic supply system of a modern transport aircraft, the air pressure is regulated. This pressure regulation occurs just before the manifold by the:

options.text: low pressure bleed air valve.
intermediate pressure check-valve.
fan bleed air valve.
high pressure bleed air valve.

1mTGyQw8.question: Cabin air for a large aeroplane during flight:

options.text: is temperature controlled.
has a reduced oxygen ratio.
has a constant oxygen ratio regulated to a preset value.

9LG7vFV4.question: The manual mode of a typical aeroplane`s pressurisation control system

options.text: uses a separate circuit to control the operation of the outflow valve(s).

uses a separate circuit to control the operation of the safety relief valve(s).

YzkY8lKD.question: The air source for the vapour-cycle machine in a piston engine airplane is:

options.text: Air from the compressor of the turbocharger.
Air from the turbine of the turbocharger.

vkv2rGlx.question: Cabin heating in a large jet transport aeroplane is obtained from ..

options.text: hot air bled from a compressor.
hot air bled from a turbine.
a fuel heater system.
an electrical heater system.

Xwa6UGVC.question: If the maximum certified altitude of an aeroplane is limited by the pressurised cabin, this limitation is due to the maximum...

options.text: positive cabin differential pressure at maximum cabin altitude.
cabin rate of descent.
cabin rate of climb.
negative cabin differential pressure at maximum cabin altitude.

57MWu5uw.question: The term bootstrap, when used to identify a cabin air conditioning and pressurisation system, refers to the...

options.text: air cycle machine.
air supply across the intercooler heat exchanger.
means by which pressurisation is controlled.
source of the air supply.

69C8Sm4t.question: For this question refer to the annex. The cabin altitude of an aeroplane is 6000 ft. - Following a requirement to reduce the differential pressure to 7 psi, what is the maximum aeroplane pressure altitude that can be maintained in order to maintain the same cabin altitude?

AdMjHjUJ.question: In normal operation the maximum cabin altitude for transport aeroplanes is:

5O7ht35G.question: If during a straight and level cruising flight at FL310 a malfunction of the pressure controller drives the outflow/discharge valve to the fully closed position:

options.text: the cabin rate indicator will show a descent.
the inward relief valves will operate at 0.5 psi differential pressure.
the differential pressure will decrease.
the cabin altitude will increase.

9rGNVgMQ.question: The pressurization system of a typical transport aeroplane:

options.text: has the capability to maintain a cabin pressure higher than ambient pressure.
will maintain approximately a sea level cabin altitude at all flight altitudes.
will maintain a zero cabin differential pressure at all altitudes.
only pressurizes the passenger cabin area.

0vqK1Fx5.question: Temperature regulation of an air conditioning system:

options.text: is automatically controlled by sensing the output temperature from the control valve in relation to the temperature set on the pilot's control panel.
is manually controlled by the pilot reading the cabin temperature gauge and increasing or decreasing hot air as required.
cannot be automatically controlled.
is automatically controlled by sensing cabin temperature in relation to engine compressor outlet temperatures.

OIE6gq77.question: In an air cycle machine (bootstrap system), bleed air downstream of the first heat exchanger is:

options.text: Compressed, passed through the second heat exchanger and then passed across an expansion turbine.
Passed across an expansion turbine, then directly passed to the the second heat exchanger.
Passed across an expansion turbine, compressed and then passed through the second heat exchanger.
Compressed, then passed across an expansion turbine and finally passed across the second heat exchanger.

7I60LN2o.question: If the automatic control of an air conditioning system fails:

options.text: the pilot can revert to manual control and set the control valve to the required setting.
the system must be shut down.
a red failure light will illuminate.

Weaws0c8.question: The cabin pressure is regulated by the

options.text: outflow valve.
air-conditioning pack.
air cycle machine.
cabin airflow inlet valve.

gOOrMGkJ.question: In a typical air conditioning system of a short-haul turbojet aircraft the cabin air is not controlled in respect to the:

options.text: humidity
purity
pressure
temperature

controlled by individual passenger.
only controllable at maximum cabin differential pressure.
not controllable at the maximum cabin differential pressure.

JvZZpfD5.question: Under normal flight conditions, cabin pressure is controlled by..

options.text: regulating the discharge of air through the outflow valve/valves.
engine RPM.
inward relief valve/valves.
pressurisation duct relief valve/valves.

Om7At5yC.question: A possible pneumatic source in a single engine piston aircraft is:

options.text: Compressor pump.
Ram air turbine.
Bleed air.

a special blower on the accessory section of the air conditioning system.
controlling the negative relief valve.
regulating the bleed air supply to the cabin.

H3GzoJIl.question: For this question refer to the annex.  According to the diagram, automatic temperature control of the system is achieved by...

options.text: the temperature selector in conjunction with cabin sensors and the temperature regulator, modulating the mix valve.
the temperature selector only, modulating the mix valve.
automatic control of the ram air.
the cabin sensors and the temperature control regulator modulating the ram air.

DmjQQw27.question: The turbine in a bootstrap air conditioning system (air cycle machine):

options.text: drives the compressor and creates a temperature drop in the conditioned air.

increases the air temperature and drives the compressor.

XhcHXSrh.question: A commonly-used refrigerant in a Vapour Cycle Air Conditioning System is..

options.text: freon
nitrogen
water
helium

wW7sfZVq.question: A cabin pressure controller maintains a pre-set cabin altitude by regulating the

options.text: position of the outflow valve/valves.
position of the inward relief valve.

w6WzMskK.question: Assuming cabin pressure decreases, the cabin rate of climb indicator should indicate:

options.text: a rate of climb.
a rate of descent of approximately 300 feet per minute.
zero.

SKPGgPV8.question: In a bootstrap air cycle system, the..

options.text: turbine drives the compressor, which increases the temperature of the air, thus making the second heat exchanger more efficient.
turbine drives the compressor, which provides pressurisation.
temperature drop across the turbine is the main contributor to the cooling effect of the air cycle machine.
turbine increases the pressure of the air supply to the cabin.
been controlled in respect of temperature and pressure.
had the oxygen content reduced.
had the oxygen content increased.
had any moisture removed from it.

X5mMVgiy.question: Cabin pressurization is regulated by the

options.text: cabin outflow valves.
engine bleed valves.
cabin inlet valves.
engine RPM.

Hj9V0hBT.question: During level cruising flight, an aeroplane experiences a malfunction of the pressure controller. If the cabin vertical speed indicator reads 200 ft/min rate of descent..

options.text: the differential pressure will rise to its maximum value, thus causing the safety relief valves to open.
the aircraft has to climb to a higher flight level in order to reduce the cabin altitude to its initial value.
the crew has to intermittently cut off the incoming air flow in order to maintain a zero cabin altitude.
a descent must be initiated to prevent the oxygen masks dropping when the cabin altitude reaches 14000 ft.

BGR9Kkpg.question: Cabin air for large aeroplanes is usually taken from the ...

options.text: HP compressor.
second fan stage.
LP compressor.

results in a cabin pressure increase.
is not possible at constant aeroplane altitudes.
results in a cabin pressure decrease.
is always the same as the aeroplane's rate of descent.

TVEnHqPS.question: In a turbo compressor air conditioning system (bootstrap system), the purpose of the heat exchangers is to

options.text: cool the bleed air in front and behind the compressor of the air cycle machine.
cool bleed air before entering the complete pneumatic system.
allow a homogeneous temperature by mixing air flows from various air conditioning groups in operation.
allow a steady compressor outlet temperature.

NRV9BjsI.question:
Consider a piston-engined aircraft. Which of the systems listed below can potentially make use of air from the pneumatic system?

  5. Gyroscopic instruments
  6. Pitot-static instruments

cgJOYUPF.question: The pressurisation system of an aeroplane..

options.text: can maintain a cabin pressure higher than ambient pressure.
will maintain a sea level cabin altitude at all altitudes.

jyvhjDBj.question: The purpose of a ditching control is to

open the outflow valve(s).

the high pressure stage of the LP compressor.

Kor1jqtC.question: The bleed air pressure gauge on the flight deck shows the bleed air pressure relative to...

options.text: atmospheric pressure.

Qih0iVhk.question: Cabin air for large aeroplanes is usually taken from the ..

options.text: HP compressor.

zSpOEKNW.question: What advantage has an airplane fitted with an electric-pneumatic system compared to one fitted having a bleed air source?

c6AhmlL1.question: The cabin pressure is controlled by

options.text: the outflow valves.
the inflow valves.

allow a steady compressor outlet temperature.

4JJYz3VW.question: An aeroplane with a pressurised cabin is flying at FL310. Following a malfunction of the pressure controller, the outflow valve runs to the open position. - What will be the resulting cabin rate of climb indication, cabin pressure altitude, and differential pressure?

options.text: Both cabin rate of climb indication and cabin pressure altitude increase, and differential pressure decreases.
Both cabin rate of climb indication and cabin pressure altitude increase, and differential pressure increases.
Both cabin rate of climb indication and cabin pressure altitude decrease, and differential pressure increases.
